item.title: Distributional Learning of Some Nonlinear Tree Grammars
item.description: Authors Clark, Alexander and Kanazawa, Makoto and Kobele, Gregory M. and Yoshinaka, Ryo Year 2016 Abstract A key component of Clark and Yoshinakaâ€™s distributional learning algorithms is the extraction of substructures and contexts contained in the input data. This problem often becomes intractable with nonlinear grammar formalisms due to the fact that more than polynomially many substructures and/or contexts may be contained in each object. Previous works on distributional learning of nonlinear grammars avoided this difficulty by restricting the substructures or contexts that are made available to the learner.
